summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Re-Do Orders and RUSH Queue Sorting features. All 12 backend API tests passed. UI testing confirmed Re-Do Queue page, Re-Do button in order detail, RUSH queue sorting, and all related UI elements are working correctly.
passed_tests: Health check endpoint - /api/health returns healthy status
RUSH queue sorting by order_number ascending - verified orders: 7166, 8602, 8736, HOLD-TEST-001
Mark order as Re-Do - PUT /api/orders/{id}/redo with is_redo=true
Re-Do queue endpoint - GET /api/redo-queue returns Re-Do orders (excludes RUSH orders)
Re-Do queue stats endpoint - GET /api/redo-queue/stats returns total, by_department, refinish_overlap
Move Re-Do order to any department - PUT /api/redo-queue/{id}/move-to skips departments
Move Re-Do order to completed clears Re-Do flag
Remove Re-Do status - PUT /api/orders/{id}/redo with is_redo=false
RUSH overrides Re-Do - order marked as both appears only in RUSH queue
Non-Re-Do orders rejected from redo-queue move endpoint (400 error)
Invalid department rejected in move endpoint (400 error)
Re-Do queue sorted by order_number ascending
UI - Re-Do Queue button visible in dashboard header with amber color
UI - Re-Do Queue page loads with stats cards (Total Re-Do, Also Refinish)
UI - Re-Do Queue page has search input and department filter
UI - Re-Do Queue page has PDF export button
UI - Re-Do button visible in order detail modal (amber color)
UI - RUSH Queue page shows orders sorted by order_number
UI - RUSH Queue shows Move To buttons for each order
seed_data_creation: Created and cleaned up test orders (TEST-REDO-*) during backend testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: Re-Do Orders and RUSH Queue Sorting features tested and working. Key endpoints: PUT /api/orders/{id}/redo (mark/unmark as Re-Do), GET /api/redo-queue (list Re-Do orders, excludes RUSH), GET /api/redo-queue/stats (statistics), PUT /api/redo-queue/{id}/move-to (move to any department). RUSH queue at GET /api/rush-queue now sorts by order_number ascending. Re-Do button in order detail modal uses amber/yellow color to differentiate from red RUSH button. RUSH orders override Re-Do - if order is both RUSH and Re-Do, it only appears in RUSH queue. Key test IDs: redo-queue-btn, redo-queue-search, redo-queue-back-btn, export-redo-pdf-btn, redo-order-{order_number}, move-redo-{order_number}.
